briefdescription.para: Compute exponential function A exp(-x/tau)
Compute y=(a0+a1)/2-(a0-a1)/2*erf((x-a2)/a3^2)
Exponent function that prevents overflow.
Exponent minus 1 function that prevents overflow.
Compute y = exp(-x/|a0|)
Compute y = a1 exp(-x/|a0|)
Compute y = a1 exp(-x/|a0|) + (1-a1) exp(-x/|a2|)
Compute y = a0 exp(-x/|a1|) + a2 exp(-x/(|a1|+|a3|)) + a4.
Compute 7 parameter exponential function value.

detaileddescription.para: Compute y = a0 exp(-x/|a1|) + a2 exp(-x/(|a1|+|a3|)) + a4 exp(-x/(|a1|+|a3|+|a5|)) + a6

briefdescription.para: Compute 9 parameter exponential function value.
Compute vac function.

memberdef.name: lmfit_exp

briefdescription.para: lmfit_exp supports fitting of different functions

detaileddescription.para: This routine calls the Levenberg-Marquardt non-linear fitting routine for fitting a data set with errors to a target function. Fitting routines included in gromacs in src/external/lmfit.

briefdescription.para: Ensure the fitting parameters are well-behaved.

detaileddescription.para: In order to make sure that fitting behaves according to the constraint that time constants are positive and increasing we enforce this here by setting all time constants to their absolute value and by adding e.g. |a_0| to |a_2|. This is done in conjunction with the fitting functions themselves. When there are multiple time constants we make sure that the successive time constants are at least double the previous ones and during fitting we enforce the they remain larger. It may very well help the convergence of the fitting routine.

briefdescription.para: Process the fitting parameters to get output parameters.

detaileddescription.para: See comment at the previous function.

memberdef.argsstring: (FILE *fp, const int eFitFn, const double fitparms[], const char *label, const int nfitpnts, const double x[], const double y[])
memberdef.name: print_chi2_params

briefdescription.para: Print chi-squared value and the parameters.

memberdef.argsstring: (int ndata, real c1[], real sig[], real dt, real *x0, real begintimefit, real endtimefit, const gmx_output_env_t *oenv, gmx_bool bVerbose, int eFitFn, double fitparms[], int fix, const char *fn_fitted)
memberdef.name: do_lmfit

briefdescription.para: Use Levenberg-Marquardt method to fit to a nfitparm parameter exponential or to a transverse current autocorrelation function.

detaileddescription.para:
If x == NULL, the timestep dt will be used to create a time axis.
ndata
Number of data points
c1
The data points
sig
The standard deviation in the points (can be NULL)
dt
The time step
x0
The X-axis (may be NULL, see above)
begintimefit
Starting time for fitting
endtimefit
Ending time for fitting
oenv
Output formatting information
bVerbose
Should the routine write to console?
eFitFn
Fitting function (0 .. effnNR)
fitparms[]
Fitting parameters, see printed manual for a detailed description. Note that in all implemented cases the parameters corresponding to time constants will be generated with increasing values. Such input parameters should therefore be provided in increasing order. If this is not the case or if subsequent time parameters differ by less than a factor of 2, they will be modified to ensure tau_i+1 >= 2 tau_i.
fix
Constrains fit parameter i at it's starting value, when the i'th bit of fix is set. This works only when the N last parameters are fixed but not when a parameter somewhere in the middle needs to be fixed.
fn_fitted
If not NULL file to print the data and fitted curve to
integral.

memberdef.argsstring: (int ncorr, int fitfn, const gmx_output_env_t *oenv, gmx_bool bVerbose, real tbeginfit, real tendfit, real dt, real c1[], real *fit)

briefdescription.para: Fit an autocorrelation function to a pre-defined functional form.

parameterdescription.para: Should the routine write to console?

simplesect.para: the integral over the autocorrelation function?
